channel.title: Homes on Siddharth Vij
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Siddharth Vij

item.description: Welcome to my website! I am an Assistant Professor of Finance in the Terry College of Business at the University of Georgia. I conduct primarily empirical research in banking and corporate finance. I completed a Ph.D. in Finance at the New York University Stern School of Business in May 2018.

item.title: Working Papers
item.description: Unearthing Zombies (with Nirupama Kulkarni, SK Ritadhi, and Katherine Waldock ) [Paper] Abstract Zombie lending interferes with efficient credit allocation. Using new supervisory data from India, we examine two reforms targeting zombie credit: a bankruptcy law and a regulatory intervention requiring that lenders recognize bad loans. Zombie recognition after the bankruptcy reform is muted in weakly capitalized and government-owned banks. The subsequent regulatory intervention goes further in forcing the recognition of zombie loans at weakly capitalized banks, but effects remain muted among government-owned banks.
